0.title: Ironic how people say 'Twitter is dead', on Twitter: Binance CEO
0.article_body: As '#RIPTwitter' trended on Twitter amid reports of mass resignations, Binance CEO Changpeng Zhao posted, "Ironic how people say "Twitter is dead", on Twitter." The resignations came after Elon Musk gave an ultimatum to employees to sign up for "long hours at high intensity", or leave. Binance had invested $500 million in Musk's $44 billion deal to buy Twitter.

1.title: SC dismisses pleas seeking to enforce two-child norm
1.article_body: The Supreme Court on Friday dismissed a batch of petitions seeking to enforce a two-child norm to control population in the country. The two-judge bench said that the issue is for the government to look at and the court should not interfere. Earlier, the Delhi High Court had dismissed a plea seeking steps, including a two-child norm, for population control.

2.title: Byculla zoo opens online ticket service, bottle crusher machines being put up
2.article_body: The Byculla Zoo in Mumbai has opened up online ticket services for its customers. Citizens will now be able to book tickets using a web link, reports said. Further, according to reports, the BMC is also installing plastic bottle crusher machines inside the premises of the zoo. The machines are being installed under the CSR programme.

3.title: Delhi pvt unaided schools can charge over 5 paise/day as late payment fee: HC
3.article_body: Delhi High Court has allowed private unaided schools in the national capital to charge over five paise/day for late payment of fees after 10th of every month. It's "inconsistent" to suggest these schools are free to levy fees but have to levy five paise/day fine, court said. It added that private unaided schools' fees are higher than aided schools' fees.

4.title: 2 Pune hotels raided for running illegal hookah parlours; 3 booked
4.article_body: Pune's Koregaon Park police has raided two hotels on charges of running illegal hookah parlours. One person was booked following the raid at the first hotel, while two other people were booked for operating beyond the permitted closure time after the second hotel was raided. The police also seized items worth a total of ₹9,300 in both raids.

5.title: Gujarat is riot-free because of PM Narendra Modi: Anurag Thakur
5.article_body: Union Minister Anurag Thakur praised the BJP and PM Narendra Modi for making Gujarat riot-free. He further asserted that the BJP works on the basis of good governance, development and honesty. "The more Gujarat progresses, the more India will progress. If Gujarat wins, then India will progress…Congress did politics only on [the] basis of divide and rule," said Anurag Thakur.

6.title: FTX's Bankman-Fried cashed out $300 mn in 2021 funding round: WSJ
6.article_body: FTX Founder Sam Bankman-Fried received $300 million of $420 million raised by the company in its October 2021 funding round, The Wall Street Journal reported. He reportedly sold some of his personal stake in FTX. He told investors it was partial reimbursement of money he'd spent to buy out Binance's stake in FTX a few months earlier, the report stated.

7.title: US court to decide if Musk's $56-bn salary justifies Tesla growth
7.article_body: After five days of testimony, a Delaware court will now decide if Tesla CEO Elon Musk's $56-billion pay package was justified by the company's growth or undermined by a flawed process. Tesla shareholder Richard Tornetta claimed that Musk's 2018 pay package was to subservient directors and approved by a vote of shareholders who were misled by Tesla.

8.title: TSRTC starts AC minibus services from Raidurg Metro Station
8.article_body: Telangana State Road Transport Corporation (TSRTC) has decided to run Vajra AC minibus services from Raidurg Metro Station in Hyderabad after receiving multiple requests from the employees working in the IT corridor. Earlier, the employees had to either walk for over two kilometres or pay for a cab at a high rate.

9.title: Parliament's winter session to begin on Dec 7, will last for 23 days
9.article_body: Union Minister of Parliamentary Affairs Pralhad Joshi said on Friday that the winter session of Parliament will begin on December 7. "Winter session...will...continue till December 29 having 17 sittings spread over 23 days," he added. "Looking forward to discussions on legislative business and other items during the session," he said.

10.title: Nothing wrong in my Insta post: IAS officer-actor as he's sacked from Guj poll duty
10.article_body: IAS officer-turned-actor Abhishek Singh has reacted after he was relieved of his poll duties in Gujarat elections over his Instagram post announcing his posting. "I accept the Hon'ble ECI's decision with all humility. Though I believe there's nothing wrong in this post...It's neither publicity nor a stunt," he tweeted. The Election Commission reportedly called his post a publicity stunt.

11.title: There is a possibility of another attack on Imran Khan: Pak judge
11.article_body: Citing an intelligence report, the Chief Justice of Islamabad High Court said there's a possibility of another assassination attempt on ex-PM Imran Khan. "It's the responsibility of the government and the state to look into the matter," Chief Justice Aamer Farooq said. Earlier this month, Khan was shot in the leg by an attacker during a rally demanding immediate elections.

12.title: Overhead water tank of transit camp bursts in Mumbai, 2 houses damaged
12.article_body: The overhead water tank of a ground-plus-four-storey transit camp at Gautam Nagar in Mumbai's Dadar burst on Monday. The incident took place around 7 am. Reports said that two homes on the topmost floor of the building were damaged. A resident of the building said that when the tank burst, water surged into his room and the furniture was damaged.

13.title: Musk calls all coders to Twitter headquarters after 1,200 employees resign: Reports
13.article_body: Elon Musk has reportedly sent a company email to the Twitter engineering team asking "anyone who actually writes software" to report to Twitter headquarters in San Francisco by 2 pm (PST) on Friday. This comes after around 1,200 Twitter employees resigned by declining to click 'Yes' on a form Musk sent out requiring employees to commit to working long hours.

14.title: Bengaluru Metro to provide 175 km of connectivity by June 2025: MD
14.article_body: Bengaluru Metro will provide 175 km of connectivity in the city by June 2025, said BMRCL Managing Director Anjum Parwez on Friday. Speaking at the Bengaluru Tech Summit 2022, Parwez added that the metro connectivity will reach 314 km by 2041. The construction of metro lines near the airport is progressing well, he further said.

15.title: Italy rejects Google’s appeal against $10 mn fine, accepts Apple’s
15.article_body: An Italian administrative court on Friday rejected an appeal by Google against a $10.36 million fine by Italy's antitrust authority AGCM. However, it accepted Apple's appeal against a similar fine. AGCM fined Google and Apple $10.36 million each last year, claiming that they had not provided "clear and immediate information" on how they collect and use users' data.

16.title: Mumbai man looking to check PF balance loses ₹1.23 lakh in 14 transactions
16.article_body: A 47-year-old man lost ₹1.23 lakh in 14 different transactions while he was allegedly looking for EPFO's helpline number to check his PF balance in Mumbai. He called up a number thinking it to be of customer care. The fraudster made him download an application. The victim also shared a nine-digit code with the fraudster.

17.title: Musk starts poll on whether to reinstate Trump, says 'Voice of people is voice of God'
17.article_body: Elon Musk on Friday started a Twitter poll asking users whether the former President Donald Trump should be reinstated on the platform. He followed up his tweet with the Latin phrase, "Vox Populi, Vox Dei," which translates to, "The voice of the people is the voice of God." Twitter permanently suspended Trump after the US Capitol riots in January 2021.

18.title: Kim Jong-un's daughter seen in public for 1st time at N Korea's ballistic missile test
18.article_body: North Korean leader Kim Jong-un's daughter was seen in public for the first time on Friday in photos shared by state news agency KCNA. The photos showed the leader and his daughter hand-in-hand inspecting the launch of the country's largest ballistic missile. Kim has three children with his wife Ri Sol Ju, as per South Korea's National Intelligence Service.

19.title: Theranos Founder Elizabeth Holmes sentenced to 11 years in jail for fraud
19.article_body: Theranos Founder Elizabeth Holmes was sentenced to 11 years and three months in prison by a California judge on Friday for defrauding investors in her now-defunct blood testing startup. The 38-year-old Stanford dropout was sentenced on three counts of investor fraud and one count of conspiracy. Theranos was once valued at $9 billion, before its collapse in 2018.

20.title: Twitter's crypto head quits as part of mass exit of staff at firm
20.article_body: Twitter's crypto development team head Tess Rinearson has quit the firm as part of employees' mass exit after Twitter's new owner Elon Musk asked the employees to commit to an "extremely hardcore" culture. Rinearson posted a tweet with the salute emoji, followed by a blue heart. Senior software engineer of the crypto unit Hamdi Allam has also left the firm.

21.title: Berkshire warns investors about crypto website using its name
21.article_body: Berkshire Hathaway warned investors on Friday that it has no affiliation with a purported crypto brokerage website, berkshirehathawaytx.com. "The entity who has this web address has no affiliation with Berkshire Hathaway...or its Chairman...Warren E Buffett," Berkshire said. The website includes purported customer testimonials and describes its operator as a Texas-based broker founded in 2020.

22.title: Novak Djokovic defeats Daniil Medvedev to stay unbeaten in ATP Finals
22.article_body: World number eight Novak Djokovic stayed unbeaten in the round-robin stage of the ATP Finals by defeating world number five, Russia's Daniil Medvedev, 6-3, 6-7(7-5), 7-6(7-2) at the Pala Alpitour in Turin on Friday. With this, Djokovic topped the Red Group. Djokovic will face Taylor Fritz in the semi-final on Saturday.

23.title: Girls forced into prostitution in numerous Rajasthan districts: NCW
23.article_body: The National Commission for Women (NCW) said it has evidence of young girls being forced into prostitution in "numerous districts" of Rajasthan like Sawai Madhopur, Bhilwara and Bharatpur. The NCW said people were hiding the "true extent" of the crime "due to threats from the panchayat and local government". The commission has asked for an SIT probe from the Centre.

24.title: Canadian man arrested for alleged plot to overthrow Haitian govt
24.article_body: Canadian police have arrested a 51-year-old man from Quebec for allegedly planning "a terrorist act to overthrow the Haitian government of (former President) Jovenel Moise". The Royal Canadian Mounted Police (RCMP) said the arrest was made after an investigation that started last year. The accused planned "to stage an armed revolution" and ultimately wanted to "seize power", the RCMP said.

25.title: Northern Ireland police vehicle damaged in suspected bomb attack
25.article_body: A homemade bomb has damaged a police vehicle in Strabane, Northern Ireland, officials said, adding that the incident "appears to have been a targeted attack on police". The attack, which occurred on Thursday, is believed to have been caused by an improvised explosive device, police said. Two officers, who were in the vehicle at the time, have escaped without injury.

26.title: Beijing district records spike in COVID-19 cases
26.article_body: Officials in the Chinese capital Beijing's biggest district, Chaoyang, have advised residents to stay at home this weekend due to a spike in COVID-19 cases. Chaoyang on Thursday reported 466 cases. The advice comes as China is easing its COVID-19-related restrictions policy. Now, restrictions are being enforced in specific outbreak zones. Capacity limits at entertainment venues were also scrapped.

27.title: Karnataka govt removes restrictions on sandalwood farming: Report
27.article_body: The Karnataka Government has reportedly removed all restrictions on growing and marketing sandalwood in the state. "There is a huge demand...in national and international markets...this will encourage farmers," said Karnataka Health Minister K Sudhakar. To protect farmers from smugglers, the state will reportedly install a microchip in the trees to alert officials when someone tries to cut them.

28.title: Terror financing more dangerous than terrorism itself: Amit Shah
28.article_body: Home Minister Amit Shah said terror financing is more dangerous than terrorism itself. "The transformation of terrorism from 'dynamite to metaverse' and 'AK-47 to virtual assets' is definitely a matter of concern," said Shah. He added that there is an increase in the use of "virtual assets like cryptocurrency" and there is a need to understand "patterns" of darknet activities.

29.title: Death toll from gas tank explosion in northern Iraq rises to 15
29.article_body: The death toll from an explosion caused by a heating gas tank in a residential complex in northern Iraq has risen to 15, a civil defence official said on Friday. There are no more bodies buried under the rubble, he added. The explosion on Thursday in the city of Sulaymaniyah destroyed three houses and injured 16 people, as per authorities.

30.title: 140 inmates of Dasna Jail in Ghaziabad diagnosed with HIV: Official
30.article_body: As many as 140 inmates of Dasna District Jail in Ghaziabad have been diagnosed with HIV, said District Jail Superintendent Alok Kumar Singh on Friday. As per the rules, all prisoners are tested for HIV before they are lodged in jail. "An average of 120 to 150 HIV-positive inmates are living in the jail since 2016," Singh said.

31.title: Supreme Court Collegium recommends transfer of 3 HC judges: Report
31.article_body: The Supreme Court Collegium has recommended transferring three high court (HC) judges for administrative reasons, PTI reported on Friday. Madras High Court's Acting Chief Justice T Raja was recommended for transfer to the Rajasthan High Court. Justice Nikhil S Kariel (Gujarat High Court) and Justice A Abhishek Reddy (Telangana High Court) were recommended for transfer to the Patna High Court.

32.title: Japanese journalist freed by Myanmar junta returns home
32.article_body: A 26-year-old Japanese filmmaker and video journalist who was sentenced to 10 years in prison by Myanmar's military junta after being arrested in July, returned to Japan on Friday. Toru Kubota and three other foreign prisoners were released as part of a broad prisoner amnesty under which the junta also freed many local citizens held for protesting the army takeover.

33.title: Football commentator kisses Ukrainian player's foot in the name of Kerala, criticised
33.article_body: Malayalam football commentator Shaiju Damodaran kissed the foot of Kerala Blasters' Ukrainian footballer Ivan Kaliuzhnyi for a YouTube video after the latter scored a goal against FC Goa. Damodaran said that the kiss was in the name of entire Kerala. Criticising him, a user said, "I'm a fan of you and Kerala Blasters...but I don't belong to...Kerala which you mentioned."

34.title: Earthquake of magnitude 6.7 strikes southwest of Indonesia’s Sumatra
34.article_body: An earthquake of magnitude 6.7 struck southwest of Sumatra, Indonesia on Friday, the European-Mediterranean Seismological Centre (EMSC) said. The quake was at a depth of 10 km (6.21 miles), the EMSC added. There was no tsunami threat due to the earthquake. Further, no injuries or loss of property has been reported so far.

35.title: Tesla recalls around 30,000 Model X cars over front passenger airbag issue
35.article_body: Tesla has recalled nearly 30,000 Model X cars over an issue that may cause the front passenger airbag to deploy incorrectly, according to a company letter filed with US NHTSA. The problem will be fixed through an over-the-air software update, the company said. Earlier this month, Tesla recalled over 40,000 Model S and Model X vehicles over steering issue.

36.title: US-based used car retailer Carvana lays off 1,500 employees
36.article_body: US-based used car retailer Carvana is laying off around 1,500 people, or 8% of its workforce, CNBC reported citing an internal message. The email from CEO Ernie Garcia cited economic headwinds including higher financing costs and delayed car purchasing. He added the company "failed to accurately predict how this would all play out and...impact it would have on our business".

37.title: Will install Savarkar's statue in front of Cong HQ: Hindu Mahasabha
37.article_body: Akhil Bharat Hindu Mahasabha President Swami Chakrapani on Friday said that the party will install a statue of freedom fighter Veer Savarkar in front of Congress headquarters at Akbar Road in Delhi. He also asked PM Narendra Modi to rename Akbar Road as Veer Savarkar Road. This comes after Congress MP Rahul Gandhi claimed that Savarkar had helped British rulers.

38.title: All SC benches to take up 10 transfer pleas daily: CJI Chandrachud
38.article_body: All Supreme Court (SC) benches should take up 10 bail applications and 10 transfer petitions every day, said Chief Justice of India (CJI) DY Chandrachud on Friday. The CJI said that this decision was taken at a full-court meeting. He said there are about 3,000 transfer petitions pending and these will be decided before the winter break.

39.title: Simon Doull shares pic of seats at Wellington ground, says 'What a shambles of a place'
39.article_body: Commentator Simon Doull took to Twitter to criticise facilities at Sky Stadium in Wellington where the first T20I between India and New Zealand was abandoned due to rain today. He shared pictures of seats in commentary area and wrote, "I've just cleaned all...seats...so our overseas guests can sit down. What a shambles of a place. Embarrassing."

40.title: Activist projects 'Elon Musk: Space Karen, Mediocre Manchild' on Twitter HQ
40.article_body: An activist projected a message calling Twitter owner Elon Musk 'Space Karen, Mediocre Manchild, Petulant Pimple, Bankruptcy Baby' on Twitter's headquarters in San Francisco. A video of the projected ticker has surfaced online. This came amid reports of a mass exodus of employees from the company after Musk told employees to be "extremely hardcore" or leave Twitter.

41.title: Shouldn't see some faces again in next T20 World Cup: Sehwag
41.article_body: Virender Sehwag said he wants some changes in the Indian team for T20 World Cup 2024. "I don't want changes in...thinking process or anything else...In the next World Cup, you shouldn't see some faces again," he stated. "You have two years to examine and there are some senior players whose performances are not up to the mark," Sehwag added.

42.title: Looking forward to seeing how Hardik leads India in T20Is vs NZ: Shastri
42.article_body: Ex-India head coach Ravi Shastri said he's looking forward to seeing the way skipper Hardik Pandya leads Team India in T20I series against New Zealand. "He has got the flamboyance...the exuberance. That will reflect on the players in the team," he added. The first T20I of the three-match series was abandoned due to rain in Wellington on Friday.

43.title: 4-yr-old Kerala boy mauled by pack of stray dogs, sustains 40 wounds
43.article_body: A four-year-old boy suffered critical injuries after a pack of stray dogs mauled him in Kerala's Tanalur on Friday. The child, identified as Mohammed Riswan, sustained over 40 wounds all over his body, including the head. He is currently undergoing treatment at a government hospital in Kozhikode. The incident took place when Riswan was standing near his house.

44.title: Manchester United to sue Cristiano Ronaldo and ban him from club: Reports
44.article_body: Manchester United have appointed lawyers to sue Cristiano Ronaldo for alleged breach of contract after claims made by him in an interview, as per reports. The 37-year-old has reportedly been instructed not to return to the club's Carrington training base after his participation with Portugal in World Cup. In the interview, Ronaldo had spoken against the club owners and manager.

45.title: It was probably the best I've felt in about 6 years: Steve Smith on 80* vs England
45.article_body: Talking about his 80*(78) against England in first ODI, Australia batter Steve Smith said, "It was probably the best I've felt in about six years." "I was just in really nice positions and I felt really good...I honestly haven't felt that way in six years," he added. During the innings, Smith was heard telling David Warner, "I am back, baby."

46.title: It didn't need to be like this: Gary Neville on Ronaldo's interview
46.article_body: Former Manchester United defender Gary Neville said a "mature conversation" between Cristiano Ronaldo and the club could have averted the situation that led to the forward's interview. "Sad that...arguably United's greatest-ever talent is likely to be sacked," said Neville. He added that "it didn't need to be like this" and Ronaldo could have "secured a smooth exit".

47.title: Chopped hand found at cemetery in Bihar's Darbhanga district
47.article_body: A severed human hand was found at a cemetery in Bihar's Darbhanga district on Friday, police informed. The hand was first found on the cemetery ground on Wednesday, following which locals buried it in the ground. However, they informed the police about the matter after a stench filled the area. Police reached there and took the hand in their possession.

48.title: They didn't sulk: Karthik on Chahal, Harshal not playing a single match in T20 WC 2022
48.article_body: Talking about Yuzvendra Chahal and Harshal Patel not getting a single game in T20 World Cup 2022, Dinesh Karthik said, "They did not sulk, they were not upset." He added, "At the start of the tournament, they were told that under these certain conditions we will be playing you, otherwise it will be hard for us. So, they were aware."

49.title: Uruguay, Argentina carry combined 900-kg meat to Qatar for FIFA World Cup
49.article_body: Uruguay and Argentina have carried a combined over 900 kg of meat to Qatar for FIFA World Cup 2022. "The Uruguayan Football Association is a historic ambassador of our country and will take with it another ambassador, which is Uruguayan meat, the best meat in the world," the association's president Ignacio Alonso said. The World Cup will begin on Sunday.

50.title: No truth to it: Adani Group on reports of Adani planning to open family office overseas
50.article_body: After reports claimed that Gautam Adani is planning to open a family office in Dubai or New York, Adani Group issued a clarification. "There is no truth to this claim. Neither Mr Adani nor the Adani Family has any plan or is in consultations to open a family office overseas," the group said in a statement.

51.title: Nico Hulkenberg replaces Mick Schumacher at Haas F1 for 2023 season
51.article_body: Nico Hulkenberg will replace fellow German Mick Schumacher at Haas F1 for the 2023 season. The 35-year-old has previously driven for Williams, Force India, Sauber, Renault, as well as Aston Martin, and will partner with Kevin Magnussen. Mick, son of the seven-time world champion Michael Schumacher, lost his Haas seat after two years due to poor results and multiple accidents.

52.title: Best news possible: Nadal on Djokovic being granted visa to play in Aus Open
52.article_body: Commenting on unvaccinated Novak Djokovic being granted a visa to play in Australian Open 2023, Rafael Nadal said, "That's the best news possible, especially knowing that now the virus is more under control, seems, around the world. So why not?" Djokovic was deported from Australia in January 2022 and handed a three-year visa ban due to his COVID-19 vaccination status.

53.title: Only 14% of POCSO cases lead to convictions: Report
53.article_body: Only 14.03% of cases under the Protection of Children from Sexual Offences (POCSO) Act lead to convictions, an independent think-tank has reported. The report was prepared by the Vidhi Centre for Legal Policy in collaboration with the Data Evidence for Justice Reform programme of the World Bank. The report analysed cases under the POCSO Act in eCourts across the country.

54.title: Hera Pheri without Akshay Kumar is unthinkable: Gulshan Grover
54.article_body: Actor Gulshan Grover, reacting to Akshay Kumar's exit from 'Hera Pheri 3', said, "I have to say Hera Pheri without Akshay is unthinkable." He added that the film is identified with its characters. "So it'll be fantastic to see them back because these characters have remained in...minds of audiences," Gulshan, who was a part of the first film, further said.

55.title: More than 10 Russian POWs executed by Ukraine: Russia
55.article_body: Russia said on Friday that Ukraine had executed more than 10 Russian prisoners of war (POWs) with "direct shots to the head". Russia's Defence Ministry made the claim while confirming the veracity of a video claiming to show the execution of Russian POWs. "This...murder of Russian servicemen is neither the first nor the only war crime [by Ukraine]," it said.

56.title: Avalanche kills three Indian Army jawans near LoC in J&K
56.article_body: Three soldiers of Indian Army's 56 Rashtriya Rifles achieved martyrdom on Friday after being hit by an avalanche near the Line of Control in Jammu and Kashmir's Kupwara. Police said the bodies of the jawans, who died in the line of duty, have been recovered. The deceased have been identified as Souvik Hajra, Mukesh Kumar and Gaikwad Manoj Laxman Rao.

57.title: Committed to working quickly on UK-India FTA: UK PM Sunak
57.article_body: UK Prime Minister Rishi Sunak said that the UK government remains committed to working "as quickly as possible" towards a successful conclusion to the ongoing free trade agreement (FTA) talks with India. He reiterated that he would not "sacrifice quality for speed" after he was questioned over FTA missing its Diwali deadline.

58.title: Missile capable of targeting entire US test-fired by North Korea, says Japan
58.article_body: North Korea has test-fired an Intercontinental Ballistic Missile (ICBM) that has a range of over 15,000 kilometres, Japanese Defence Minister Yasukazu Hamada has said. The range is enough to cover the entire mainland United States, Hamada said. The missile was launched in the second major weapons test this month and landed near Japanese waters on Friday.

59.title: Vicky calls Katrina Kaif a 'scientist', says 'She has a lot of knowledge'
59.article_body: Actor Vicky Kaushal during an event described his actress-wife Katrina Kaif as a "scientist" and said, "She has a lot of knowledge." "But she helps me a lot and is always making sure I am eating well, taking care of myself, sleeping well, and not just running around to work," he added. Vicky and Katrina tied the knot in 2021.

60.title: Proud: Rijiju on Manika becoming 1st Indian woman to reach Asian Cup semis
60.article_body: Reacting to table tennis player Manika Batra becoming the first Indian woman to reach the semi-final of Asian Cup, Union Law Minister Kiren Rijiju took to Twitter and wrote, "Proud of Manika Batra." The 27-year-old defeated Chinese Taipei's Chen Szu-Yu 6-11, 11-6, 11-5, 11-7, 8-11, 9-11, 11-9 in the quarter-final on Friday. Manika will face Japan's Mima Ito on Saturday.

61.title: Haven't watched it, so I'm ok with it: Bruno on Ronaldo's interview
61.article_body: Manchester United midfielder Bruno Fernandes said he has not watched fellow Portuguese forward Cristiano Ronaldo's interview so he's "ok with" it. Fernandes said the Portuguese team is currently concentrating on the FIFA World Cup as it "doesn't come around many times". He added that the handshake video of the duo that went viral was actually of Cristiano joking with him.

62.title: FM Sitharaman to begin pre-budget meet with stakeholders from Nov 21
62.article_body: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman will start the customary pre-budget meetings with stakeholders from November 21, with a special emphasis on climate change and infrastructure-related issues. She would meet representatives from agriculture industry and financial sector on November 22. Meetings with the trade union representatives and economists are scheduled for November 28.

63.title: My role in New Zealand team is to be aggressive bowler: Ish Sodhi
63.article_body: New Zealand leg-spinner Ish Sodhi said that his role in the side is to be an aggressive bowler. "I am all for aggressive bowlers in attacks. Blessed to have bowlers who can bowl 150 kmph like Adam Milne and Lockie Ferguson. Mitchell Santner is economical on the other end," Sodhi said. He added that leg-spinners are an "important weapon".

64.title: Ronaldo finding it difficult to accept that he’s getting old: Rooney
64.article_body: Former Manchester United forward Wayne Rooney has responded to Cristiano Ronaldo's criticism and said the Portuguese star is finding it hard to deal with the fact that he's ageing. "Some of the comments, they're strange, but I'm sure Manchester United will deal with it," said Rooney. Ronaldo had said that Rooney criticised him because the English footballer's career is "finished".

65.title: Mamata a respected CM, will work with her objectively: Governor-designate
65.article_body: The newly appointed West Bengal Governor Dr CV Ananda Bose said that he sees Mamata Banerjee as a respected CM. "I've an open mind and will work with her with objectivity," Bose said, adding that West Bengal is a great state. "If Governor and CM keep themselves well within the confines of the Constitution, there'll be no difficulty," he added.

66.title: Rahul Gandhi only mentioned facts about VD Savarkar: Jairam Ramesh
66.article_body: Congress leader Jairam Ramesh defended Rahul Gandhi saying that he did not target VD Savarkar but only highlighted a "historical fact". "Gandhi had mentioned...how tribal leader Birsa Munda did not compromise with the British while Savarkar signed a mercy petition," claimed Ramesh. He added that Rahul's statement will have no bearing on the MVA alliance with Uddhav Thackeray-led Shiv Sena.

67.title: Punjab govt approves reimplementation of Old Pension Scheme
67.article_body: Punjab Chief Minister Bhagwant Mann on Friday announced that the state Cabinet has approved the reimplementation of the Old Pension Scheme. The state government said the scheme will directly benefit more than 1.75 lakh government employees. The scheme, under which the entire pension amount was given by the government, was discontinued in India from April 1, 2004.

68.title: Jofra Archer likely to return to cricket in early 2023: Reports
68.article_body: After being out since July 2021 owing to an injury, England pacer Jofra Archer is reportedly expected to return to cricket in early 2023. "He (Archer) is currently in the UAE with the England Lions team and is continuing his rehab. He is making excellent progress," an ECB spokesman told Cricbuzz. Notably, Archer has been retained by Mumbai Indians.

69.title: Just to seek attention: Fadnavis on Rahul Gandhi's remarks on Savarkar
69.article_body: Maharashtra Deputy CM Devendra Fadnavis on Friday criticised Congress leader Rahul Gandhi over his remarks on Veer Savarkar during 'Bharat Jodo Yatra' and claimed the remarks were just to seek attention. "He should speak within the legal framework. If he violates that, we will have to take action," Fadnavis said. Rahul Gandhi on Thursday claimed that Savarkar helped the British.

70.title: Farhan Akhtar shares video of daughter Akira singing on stage, pens note
70.article_body: Farhan Akhtar took to Instagram to share a video of his daughter Akira. In the video, she could be seen singing Tori Kelly's 'Don't You Worry 'Bout A Thing'. "You've come a long way @akiraakhtar, keep going. The world is your oyster. Shout out to...incredible band on stage," he wrote. Reacting to the video, Shibani Dandekar wrote, "What a star."

71.title: SC rejects NIA plea, orders Navlakha to be placed under house arrest
71.article_body: The Supreme Court (SC) on Friday dismissed the National Investigation Agency's (NIA) plea seeking a recall of activist Gautam Navlakha's house arrest order. The SC said Navlakha should be placed under house arrest within 24 hours. Navlakha is lodged in Taloja jail in Mumbai in connection with the Elgar Parishad-Maoist link case.

72.title: Gold worth ₹38 lakh seized by customs dept at Kochi airport
72.article_body: The customs department's Air Intelligence Unit seized around 422 grams of gold worth over ₹38 lakh at the Kochi airport on Friday. The gold was allegedly brought in rings and in the form of paste inside the underwear, the customs officials said. They added that a special pocket was made in the underwear and gold was sewn inside of that.

73.title: 800 kg of poppy seized in J&K's Udhampur, 2 drug peddlers held
73.article_body: Police on Friday recovered 800 kg of poppy in Jammu and Kashmir's Udhampur district and arrested two drug peddlers, officials said. A police team conducting routine checks on the Jammu-Srinagar national highway intercepted an oil tanker at Jakhani, officials added. A case has been registered against the accused, identified as Gorav and Naseeb, who hail from Sonipat.

74.title: BCCI sacks Chetan Sharma-led senior national selection committee
74.article_body: The BCCI today sacked the four-member senior national selection committee led by Chetan Sharma after India failed to reach T20 World Cup 2022 final. During Chetan's stint, India also failed to reach knockout stage of T20 World Cup 2021 and lost World Test Championship 2021 final. Harvinder Singh, Sunil Joshi and Debashish Mohanty were the other members in the committee.

75.title: Even nonsense films are working at box office after lockdown: Prateik
75.article_body: Actor Prateik Babbar said in an interview that films, which shouldn't have worked, ended up doing good at the box office after the lockdown. "I don't want to take films or actors' names, but films...which shouldn't have worked, those which have been not...bakwas but just nonsense films, even those are working at the box office," he said.

76.title: Female referees deserve to be at FIFA WC in Qatar: Mukansanga
76.article_body: Salima Mukansanga, one of the three female referees who will officiate at a men's FIFA World Cup for the first time, said they will officiate at the Qatar tournament because they deserve it. "So being here means we deserve...it's not...because we are women," Mukansanga, who is from Rwanda, said. The other two female referees are Yamashita Yoshimi and Stephanie Frappart.

77.title: Cong ruled the country to 'divide' people: Anurag Thakur in Gujarat
77.article_body: Union minister Anurag Thakur on Friday criticised Congress and said the party has ruled the country to "divide" people. Addressing a rally in Gujarat's Mandvi, Thakur said, "Congress...divided the country on the basis of caste, religion and area." "In 2013 and 14, there was a budget of...₹4200 crore for...[tribals], but the Modi-led government allotted ₹8500 crore for them," he added.

78.title: VD Savarkar a revolutionary before going to jail: Congress' Baghel
78.article_body: Chhattisgarh CM Bhupesh Baghel said VD Savarkar's life had two parts and the freedom fighter was a "revolutionary" before going to jail. "In jail he offered apologies...after coming out of jail, he acted...stark opposite to his revolutionary image," said Baghel. Recently, Congress leader Rahul Gandhi alleged that Savarkar betrayed other freedom fighters by writing an apology letter to the British.

79.title: Congress can only break the country, not unite it: BJP Prez Nadda
79.article_body: BJP President JP Nadda criticised Congress leader Rahul Gandhi and the Bharat Jodo Yatra saying that the opposition party 'can only break the country, not unite it'. "Rahul Gandhi went to Delhi's JNU and stood with those who protested against the hanging of Afzal Guru," alleged Nadda. He added that all parties, except BJP, indulged in vote bank politics.

80.title: Will miss world-class Mane: Virgil ahead of Netherlands vs Senegal in FIFA WC
80.article_body: Ahead of Netherlands-Senegal FIFA World Cup match, Netherlands captain Virgil van Dijk said he'll miss "friend" and "world-class" player Sadio Mane as the Senegalese forward was ruled out of the tournament due to a leg injury. "I'm very sorry that Sadio misses the match against us because this World Cup simply deserves...best players, Sadio is one of them," he added.

81.title: Newly-wed bride runs away with valuables from in-laws' house in Raj
81.article_body: A newly-wed bride ran away from her in-laws' house in Rajasthan's Ajmer just a day after marriage. Priyanka Gupta, who had married a businessman named Mohit, took ornaments and cash from a locker along with her. A police complaint was filed on Wednesday against Priyanka after the groom's family could not find her. Priyanka is a native of Uttar Pradesh.

82.title: Police seize heroin worth ₹14 cr, arrest 3 smugglers in Meghalaya
82.article_body: Police in Meghalaya's Ri-Bhoi district seized heroin worth ₹14 crore and arrested three smugglers on the basis of a tip-off, officials said on Friday. The drug consignment originated from Manipur and was headed for Meghalaya's capital Shillong, Meghalaya CM Conrad Sangma said in a tweet. The consignment was sent through a bus which has been seized as well, ANI reported.

83.title: US' Taylor Fritz reaches semis on ATP Finals debut in Turin
83.article_body: US' Taylor Fritz defeated Canadian Felix Auger-Aliassime 7-6(7-4), 6-7(5-7), 6-2 in Green Group to reach the semi-final on debut at ATP Finals in Turin on Thursday. Top seed Rafael Nadal, who had already been eliminated from semi-final contention after back-to-back straight-sets defeats in Green Group by Fritz and Auger-Aliassime, won his last round-robin match against Norwegian Casper Ruud.

84.title: Turkish court sends 17 suspects to jail over Istanbul blast: Report
84.article_body: A Turkish court has ordered the pre-trial detention of 17 people suspected of being involved in a blast that killed six people in Istanbul on Sunday, Turkish state media reported on Friday. The main suspect, Syrian woman Ahlam Albashir, was also among those sent to jail. The court also ordered the deportation of 29 other suspects arrested by the police.

85.title: RBI's net forex sales rises to $10.36 bn in Sept, up 144% from Aug
85.article_body: Reserve Bank of India (RBI) sold $10.36 billion worth of foreign currency on a net basis in September, the data showed. RBI said it bought $23.27 billion and sold $33.62 billion in the spot market. The sales in September were 144% higher compared to August. RBI has sold a net of $54 billion since the beginning of the year.

86.title: Aamir Khan's daughter Ira hosts her engagement ceremony, pics surface
86.article_body: Actor Aamir Khan's daughter Ira Khan hosted her formal engagement ceremony in Mumbai on Friday. Ira's boyfriend Nupur Shikhare had proposed to her in September this year. The ceremony was attended by Aamir, his nephew Imran Khan and his cousin Mansoor Khan, among others. Aamir's ex-wives Reena Dutta and Kiran Rao also attended the ceremony.

87.title: Be relentless, keep learning: Zomato Co-founder Gupta to employees in farewell note
87.article_body: As Zomato Co-founder Mohit Gupta quit the company after four-and-a-half years, he wished his colleagues and other employees "goodbye and godspeed". He said, "Please continue shining and making products that India loves using. You all are so brilliant in so many ways." Gupta added, "Be relentless, keep learning and build an organisation that's a role model for...the world."

88.title: Lawyer without brief is like Sachin without bat: CJI Chandrachud
88.article_body: CJI DY Chandrachud commented on a lawyer after the latter allegedly appeared before a Supreme Court bench without his case file. "A lawyer without a brief is like Sachin Tendulkar without his bat. This looks bad," the CJI said. He added, "You are in your gown and band but have no paper. You must always have your brief with you."

89.title: Minister Pradhan meets 96-yr-old nephew of poet Subramania Bharathiyar
89.article_body: Education Minister Dharmendra Pradhan on Friday met KV Krishnan, the 96-year-old nephew of Tamil poet Subramania Bharathiyar, and his family in Uttar Pradesh's Varanasi. Pradhan said Kashi (Varanasi) had a profound influence on shaping the poet's personality. This comes a day ahead of the inauguration of 'Kashi Tamil Sangamam', which seeks to rediscover the links between Tamil Nadu and Kashi.

90.title: Netherlands players invite migrant workers to attend their FIFA WC training session
90.article_body: Netherlands' FIFA World Cup 2022 squad on Thursday invited migrant workers who helped build the World Cup stadiums in Qatar to attend their training session and to play football together. A video of the same has gone viral on social media. Reacting to the video, a user wrote, "That's class." Meanwhile, another user wrote, "Incredible gesture!"

91.title: What are the groups for FIFA World Cup 2022 that begins on Sunday?
91.article_body: FIFA World Cup 2022 will begin in Qatar on Sunday. Hosts Qatar are in Group A with Netherlands, Ecuador and Senegal. Meanwhile, Spain and Germany are in Group E. Brazil are in Group G, while Argentina are in Group C with Saudi Arabia, Mexico and Poland. Defending champions France are in Group D with Australia, Denmark and Tunisia.

92.title: Shahid Kapoor & Anees Bazmee to team up for a comedy film: Report
92.article_body: Actor Shahid Kapoor is reportedly collaborating with director Anees Bazmee for a comedy entertainer. The film will reportedly go on floors in the first quarter of 2023. "It's a proper commercial comic entertainer and Shahid is excited to enter the world of Anees Bazmee cinema," a source was quoted as saying. Shahid was last seen in 'Jersey'.

93.title: Sun Pharma gets US FDA approval for drug to treat neonatal seizures
93.article_body: Sun Pharmaceutical Industries on Friday announced that the US Food and Drug Administration (FDA) has approved SEZABY, a phenobarbital sodium powder for injection, for the treatment of neonatal seizures. The company added that the drug was granted orphan drug designation by FDA. The drug is expected to be available in the US in the fourth quarter of FY23, it added.

94.title: Shraddha sent selfie of bruised face to boss in 2020, said 'body hurts due to beating'
94.article_body: Shraddha Walkar, who was allegedly murdered by her live-in partner Aftab in Delhi, texted her manager in 2020 about being physically abused when they lived together in Vasai. Shraddha sought leave from work and said, "Because of all the beating from yesterday...my bp is low and my body hurts." She also WhatsApped a selfie showing injury marks on her face.

95.title: 'Taarak...' actor Amit Bhatt gets injured on sets, advised bed rest: Reports
95.article_body: Actor Amit Bhatt, who plays the role of Champaklal Gada in 'Taarak Mehta Ka Ooltah Chashmah', reportedly got injured while shooting a scene. According to reports, he was required to run, but he lost his balance and fell. The doctors have advised him complete bed rest for a few days because of which he is unable to shoot, reports said.

96.title: Train services disrupted in Germany due to cargo train collision
96.article_body: Train services remained affected in Germany on Friday after a cargo train carrying 25 tanker cars filled with propane gas rammed into another cargo train near the town of Gifhorn on Thursday. The crash caused two tanker cars to leak propane into a wooded area. Four long-distance lines have been impacted, with delays and cancellations expected to last through Sunday.

97.title: Zomato Co-founder Mohit Gupta resigns
97.article_body: Zomato Co-founder Mohit Gupta has resigned after a four-and-half-year stint at the company. It's the third high-profile exit from the food delivery company in recent weeks. Zomato's new initiatives head and former food delivery chief Rahul Ganjoo had resigned earlier this week while Siddharth Jhawar, head of Zomato's Intercity Legends service, announced he had left the company a week back.

98.title: 'My body hurts because of all the beating,' Shraddha told boss on WhatsApp in 2020
98.article_body: Shraddha Walkar, who was allegedly murdered by her live-in partner Aftab in Delhi, texted her manager in 2020 about being physically abused when they lived together in Vasai. Shraddha sought leave from work and said, "Because of all the beating from yesterday...my bp is low and my body hurts." She also WhatsApped a selfie showing injury marks on her face.

99.title: When he was given the GT captaincy, many had their doubts: Kaif on Hardik
99.article_body: Mohammad Kaif said he's excited to see Hardik Pandya lead India in the three-match T20I series against New Zealand. "When he was given the [GT] captaincy, many had their doubts on whether he'd be able to do justice to the role because of his attitude or body language," he added. Hardik-led GT won the IPL title in their maiden season.

100.title: Several feared trapped as under-construction bridge collapses in Bihar
100.article_body: Several people are feared trapped after an under-construction bridge collapsed in the Bena police station area of Bihar's Nalanda on Friday, Block Development Officer Laxman Kumar said. As per the information shared by Kumar, there is no clarity on the exact number of people who got buried under the debris.

101.title: Dalit Bandhu to benefit 500 people in every constituency: T'gana minister
101.article_body: Telangana Welfare Minister Koppula Eshwar on Thursday said that the state's Dalit Bandhu scheme benefits would be ensured to 500 Dalits in every Assembly constituency. His comment came after he laid the foundation stone for various developmental works in Peddapalli. The scheme introduced for the growth of Dalits has brought changes in the lives of its beneficiaries, Eshwar added.

102.title: India's forex reserves rise by $14.7 bn, fastest growth since Aug 2021
102.article_body: India's foreign exchange reserves rose by $14.721 billion to $544.715 billion in the week ended November 11, Reserve Bank of India data showed on Friday. This marked the fastest pace of growth since August 2021. For the week ended October 28, the foreign exchange reserves had jumped $6.56 billion to $531.08 billion, then the biggest weekly jump since September 2021.

103.title: Ravan had more knowledge but Ram worshipped for his wisdom: Rajnath
103.article_body: Union Defence Minister Rajnath Singh, while addressing a convocation ceremony in Karnataka's Udupi on Friday, said that Ravan was more knowledgeable than Lord Ram, but people worship Ram more as he was wiser. Singh added that education frees those who are bound by limitations, whether it is incapacity, inequality or injustice.

104.title: Manika Batra becomes 1st Indian woman to reach Asian Cup TT semifinals
104.article_body: Manika Batra on Friday became the first Indian woman to reach the semifinals of the Asian Cup Table Tennis tournament with a 4-3 win over Chen Szu-Yu of Chinese Taipei. World number 44 Manika beat Chen 6-11, 11-6, 11-5, 11-7, 8-11, 9-11, 11-9 in quarterfinal. Manika earlier defeated world number seven Chen Xingtong of China in round of 16 match.

105.title: PM Modi to inaugurate Arunachal's first airport at Hollongi on Nov 19
105.article_body: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Saturday will inaugurate Arunachal Pradesh's first airport at Hollongi. The Donyi Polo Airport will boost connectivity, trade and tourism when it becomes operational, officials said. The airport has been developed by the Airports Authority of India at a cost of around ₹645 crore, will have eight check-in counters and can accommodate 200 passengers, officials added.

106.title: Woman's body found stuffed inside suitcase on Yamuna Expressway in UP
106.article_body: A bloodied body of an unidentified young woman was found stuffed inside a suitcase near Yamuna Expressway in Uttar Pradesh's Mathura. The body was found wrapped in plastic inside a red-coloured suitcase. "Efforts are on to identify her...It seems...she was murdered somewhere and her body was left here. There's a suspected gunshot wound near her shoulder," a police official said.

107.title: I won't stop Cameron Green from playing IPL: Pat Cummins
107.article_body: Australian skipper Pat Cummins said that he won't stop all-rounder Cameron Green from playing in the IPL. "I think the auction is a little while away. Selfishly as a captain, I'd love for Green to save all of his energy for Australia," Cummins said. "But how can you tell someone to say no to that kind of opportunity?" he asked.

108.title: 12 killed as vehicle falls into gorge in Uttarakhand's Joshimath
108.article_body: At least 12 people, including two women, were killed in a road accident near Joshimath in Uttarakhand on Friday. The accident took place when a vehicle they were travelling in fell into a deep gorge about 500-700 metres away from the road, the State Disaster Response Force (SDRF) said. Some people were reportedly sitting on the roof of the vehicle.

109.title: Jet Airways cuts salaries of 30% employees, sends many on leave without pay
109.article_body: Jet Airways CEO Sanjiv Kapoor on Friday said that salaries of around one-third (around 33%) of the airline's employees have been reduced, with most pay cuts being temporary. Around 10% of the total employees have also been sent on temporary leave without pay, Kapoor said. The "hard decisions" were taken as the "ownership transfer timeline" slipped, he added.

110.title: Samson, Hooda should play as finisher's along with Hardik for India: Uthappa
110.article_body: Robin Uthappa has said Sanju Samson and Deepak Hooda should play the finisher's role along with Hardik Pandya for India. "These are the people that they need to look at leading up to the next T20 World Cup. You need to groom them and give them enough opportunities because they can win you matches," he added.

111.title: 300-year-old mosque demolished to widen highway in Muzaffarnagar
111.article_body: A 300-year-old mosque was demolished in Uttar Pradesh's Muzaffarnagar on Thursday for widening of the Panipat-Khatima Highway. SDM Parmanand Jha said locals had earlier been asked to relocate the mosque several times but they failed to do so. Two more religious structures built on government land will be pulled down in the same stretch of the national highway, he added.

112.title: Delhi's groundwater usage regulations to be revised: Report
112.article_body: The groundwater usage regulations in Delhi, which were last notified in 2010, are likely to be revised. The revision will be in accordance with the guidelines issued by the Central Ground Water Authority in 2020, The Indian Express reported. The need to revise the regulations was brought up in a meeting of the state-level groundwater resources estimation committee.

113.title: Tell me this is not a dream: Vikram as 'Ponniyin...' earns ₹500 cr in 50 days
113.article_body: Mani Ratnam's directorial 'Ponniyin Selvan: Part One' has completed 50 days in theatres. On the occasion, the makers announced that the film has collected ₹500 crore worldwide. Vikram, who played the role of Aditha Karikalan in the film, took to Twitter on Friday to share the news and wrote, "Somebody please pinch me and tell me this isn't a dream."

114.title: Haven't met Neetu since Rishi Kapoor's death, I apologise to her: Meenakshi
114.article_body: Actress Meenakshi Seshadri in an interview opened up about not having met late actor Rishi Kapoor's wife Neetu Kapoor since his death in 2020. "I've yet to meet Neetu ji personally and talk to her (after Rishi's death). I should have done it by now, but still haven't. I apologise to her about the same. I'll meet her," she said.

115.title: Notices issued to 322 Delhi schools for not uploading exam marks online
115.article_body: The Directorate of Education under the Delhi government has issued show-cause notices to 322 heads of government schools and government-aided schools for not uploading results of mid-term examinations online on time. The mid-term examinations were conducted for classes III to XII. The schools were instructed to upload the results by November 7. The deadline was extended to November 11.

116.title: Hearing on change in PMC's panel system on November 28
116.article_body: A petition against the Maharashtra government's decision to change the panel system in the Pune Municipal Corporation (PMC) will be heard by the high court on November 28. After the Maha Vikas Aghadi government lost power, the state government led by CM Eknath Shinde decided to scrap the panel system. NCP leader Prashant Jagtap appealed against this decision.

117.title: Nigerian soldier kills colleague, aid worker, injures UN pilot
117.article_body: A Nigerian soldier on Thursday shot and wounded a UN Humanitarian Air Service (UNHAS) helicopter co-pilot before killing an aid worker and a fellow soldier at a military base in northeastern Nigeria, the army said. "Own troops on the ground immediately neutralised the errant personnel," an official stated. The motive behind the attack was not immediately clear, the army said.

118.title: 28-year-old man dies by suicide 2 days after wife's death in Pune
118.article_body: A 28-year-old man has allegedly died by suicide in Pune district's Junnar taluka, two days after his pregnant wife was killed in a road accident. The deceased man was identified as Ramesh Kanaskar, police said. His wife Vidya, 22, died on November 14. A police official said Ramesh was in a state of shock after Vidya's death.

119.title: NHRC issues notice to TN govt over death of 3 sanitation workers
119.article_body: The National Human Rights Commission (NHRC) on Friday said it issued notice to Tamil Nadu government over the alleged death of three sanitation workers during cleaning of a septic tank in Karur. "The report should...specify the awareness and sensitisation camps initiated by...government to provide security covers to workers involved in hazardous cleaning of...septic tanks," the commission said.

120.title: Conduct Aftab's narco test within 5 days, orders Delhi court
120.article_body: A court in Delhi on Friday ordered that Aftab Ameen Poonawalla, accused of killing his live-in partner Shraddha and chopping her body into 35 pieces, will be presented for a narco-analysis test within five days. The Saket court had on Thursday allowed Delhi Police to conduct the test on Aftab and question him for five more days in its custody.

121.title: 6-month-old becomes 8th measles patient to die in Mumbai this year
121.article_body: A six-month-old reportedly died due to measles in Mumbai's Kasturba Gandhi Hospital within four days of being admitted. The child, Sakina, is the eighth victim to succumb to the disease among the 169 people infected with measles this year in Mumbai. Sakina's mother said, on November 16 her baby had been taken off oxygen support and declared stable.

122.title: Umran is an exciting talent, exposure on NZ tour will help him: Zaheer
122.article_body: Zaheer Khan said pacer Umran Malik, who has been included in India's 16-member T20I and ODI squads for the New Zealand tour, is an exciting talent. He added that the kind of exposure the 22-year-old will get is going to help him. "It's about how he takes things forward if he wants to grab the spot consistently," Zaheer further said.

123.title: NZ tour is about role clarity, opportunities for new guys: Pandya
123.article_body: India's T20I skipper for the New Zealand tour, Hardik Pandya, said the Kiwi tour is about role clarity and opportunities for new players. "If the situation demands...experienced players will play different roles, but this tour is for the new guys," Pandya said. He added, "The T20 World Cup 2022 is done...The disappointment will be there, but we can't...change things."

124.title: No increase in property tax in Mumbai for third consecutive year
124.article_body: Ahead of BMC polls, the Maharashtra cabinet chaired by CM Eknath Shinde on Thursday decided to not increase property tax in Mumbai. State government has taken the decision for the third consecutive time. "Property owners, institutes and public representatives had petitioned...BMC for...waiver or relaxation," the CMO said, adding an amendment was made in Section 154 (1D) of BMC Act.

125.title: Mumbai couple 'fed up' with illness attempts suicide, woman dies
125.article_body: A 76-year-old woman died after allegedly consuming sleeping pills in a bid to die by suicide along with her 77-year-old husband in Mumbai's Borivali East. The man's condition is said to be critical and he has been admitted to a hospital. Police said the couple was "fed up" being bed-ridden with their ailments and decided to take the step.

126.title: Hrithik, rumoured girlfriend Saba to move into ₹100-cr apartment in Mumbai: Reports
126.article_body: Actor Hrithik Roshan and his rumoured girlfriend Saba Azad will move into a new apartment worth nearly ₹100 crore in Mumbai, as per reports. The property is located near the Juhu-Versova link road. The house combines a duplex and another apartment, and is spread over 38,000 sq ft in totality, reports added.

127.title: Initiated appropriate steps in response to Ronaldo's recent interview: Manchester United
127.article_body: Premier League club Manchester United have said they've initiated "appropriate steps" in response to their forward Cristiano Ronaldo's recent media interview. "We'll not be making further comment until this process reaches its conclusion," Manchester United added. Ronaldo, in the interview, had claimed that he is being forced out of the club and that he doesn't respect manager Erik ten Hag.

128.title: Rahul Gandhi gets death threat ahead of arrival in MP, letter warns of bomb blasts
128.article_body: Congress MP Rahul Gandhi received a letter in which the writer threatened him with death and also warned of bomb blasts in Indore ahead of Bharat Jodo Yatra's entry into Madhya Pradesh. Police have filed a case against an unknown person and started an investigation. The threat came after Rahul's remarks on freedom fighter Vinayak Damodar Savarkar created a row.

129.title: 50-over cricket is my strongest format: England's Dawid Malan
129.article_body: After scoring a century against Australia, English batter Dawid Malan said that 50-over cricket is his "strongest format". "It is quite tough to get into this team (England ODI team). Hopefully, if I can keep performing like this I can make my mark," Malan said. England lost the first ODI by six wickets at the Adelaide Oval on Thursday.

130.title: Bahamas regulator says it 'urgently assumed control' of FTX's digital assets
130.article_body: Securities Commission of the Bahamas said it has assumed the control of collapsed crypto exchange FTX's digital assets. It ordered the transfer of all digital assets of FTX Digital Markets (FDM) to a digital wallet owned by the commission on November 12. "Urgent interim regulatory action was necessary to protect...interests of clients and creditors of FDM," the commission said.

131.title: Students protest at Hyderabad's Osmania University for mess facility
131.article_body: Postgraduate students of Nizam College and inmates of E2 hostel protested on the campus of Hyderabad's Osmania University on Friday. They barged into the administrative building, demanding the Vice-Chancellor (VC) to open a mess facility in a hostel on the campus. A student was left bleeding after glass doors were broken in the VC's chambers. Police arrested the protesting students.

132.title: Russia says it hit energy infra, defence targets in Ukraine on Thu
132.article_body: Russian forces on Thursday struck energy infrastructure and defence targets in Ukraine using long-range weapons, Russia's Defence Ministry said on Friday. The targets that were hit included "missile manufacturing facilities", as per the ministry. About 10 million people have been left without power since the strikes, Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy said on Thursday evening.

133.title: Driver steals parcel worth ₹96 lakh from DTDC warehouse in Gurugram
133.article_body: A man who worked as a driver for a transport agency has allegedly stolen a parcel worth ₹96 lakh from a DTDC warehouse in Gurugram's Jhund Sarai village, police said on Thursday. The stolen parcel was purportedly among the boxes picked up by the agency's vehicles on September 29 and 30. An FIR has been registered against the unknown driver.

134.title: Police bust sex racket in Thane; 1 arrested, 3 rescued
134.article_body: Police busted a sex racket and arrested a woman in Kopri in Thane, Maharashtra. The racket was busted on Wednesday when the accused was allegedly striking a deal. "We have rescued two girls in the 16-17 age group and a 28-year-old woman...A case under the Indian Penal Code and Immoral Traffic (Prevention) Act has been registered," an official said.

135.title: 12 children injured as luxury bus collides with school van in Guj
135.article_body: At least 12 children sustained injuries after a school van carrying them was hit by a luxury bus in Gujarat's Gandhinagar on Friday morning. According to police, one of the students is in critical condition, while another has sustained a fracture near her right shoulder. Police have booked the driver of the bus.

136.title: E-commerce festive sales grew 25% YoY to ₹76,000 crore: Report
136.article_body: Online festive season gross sales increased 25% year-on-year to ₹76,000 crore this year, according to a report by Redseer Strategy Consultants. The fashion segment saw a 32% year-on-year growth, while mobile phones grew 7% and electronic items including appliances rose 13%. As per the report, nearly 64% of overall customers came from tier 2 and beyond cities.

137.title: Man arrested in Bengaluru by ED in ₹250 crore investment scam
137.article_body: The Enforcement Directorate (ED) arrested a person in Bengaluru in connection with a case of defrauding depositors for over ₹250 crore by luring them with the promise of high returns. An investigation was initiated by the ED against the firm of the accused, Misbahuddin S, on the basis of an FIR registered by Bengaluru's Wilson Garden Police Station.

138.title: It'll improve young players coming through: Kallis on upcoming SA20
138.article_body: Jacques Kallis has said the upcoming SA20, South Africa's first T20 league, will help the young players coming through improve their game. "With everything being televised, it's a great opportunity for the guys to put their name out there," he added. The ex-South Africa all-rounder has been appointed Pretoria Capitals' assistant coach in the league's inaugural season, beginning January 10.

139.title: 25 students fall ill due to gas leak at Kasturba college lab in Hyderabad
139.article_body: Around 25 students of Kasturba Gandhi Junior College for Women in Hyderabad's Secunderabad suffered from giddiness and fell sick on Friday after a suspected gas leak in the science laboratory. As per a report, a few students vomited blood and one is currently in critical condition. Some students have been admitted to Geetha Nursing Home in Secunderabad.

140.title: Foreign Ministry driver honey-trapped, passed info to Pak female spy: Reports
140.article_body: A driver employed at the Ministry of External Affairs (MEA) was arrested from Jawahar Lal Nehru Bhawan in New Delhi for allegedly passing sensitive information/documents to a female Pakistani spy, reports said on Friday. The female spy had reportedly honey-trapped the driver by posing as Poonam Sharma alias Pooja. Pakistan's ISI set up the honey trap, ANI reported.

141.title: Traces of explosives found at Nord Stream pipelines: Sweden
141.article_body: Investigators have found traces of explosives at the site of the damaged Nord Stream gas pipelines, confirming suspicions of sabotage, a Swedish prosecutor said on Friday. Last month, Denmark said its preliminary probe showed that powerful explosions were to be blamed for the damage to the Russian-owned pipelines. Russia has accused British Navy personnel of blowing up the underwater pipelines.

142.title: Kidnapped 14-month-old infant rescued in Hyderabad, 2 women held
142.article_body: Hyderabad Police on Thursday rescued a 14-month-old boy and arrested two women who allegedly kidnapped him to get public sympathy and collect alms. The infant was kidnapped when he was asleep with his mother, a beggar, near PVNR Expressway pillar number 13. CCTV footage showed the women holding the infant at Vikarabad railway station, after which he was rescued.

143.title: Sonic Co-creator Yuji Naka arrested in insider trading scandal: Report
143.article_body: Sonic the Hedgehog Co-creator Yuji Naka has reportedly been arrested in Japan in connection with an insider trading case related to a 'Dragon Quest' game announcement. A former Square Enix employee had obtained information about the game. Naka also was allegedly aware of the deal and bought 10,000 shares for about 2.8 million yen before it was publicly announced.

144.title: Dunzo to raise $150-200 mn, existing investors not taking part: Report
144.article_body: Hyperlocal delivery startup Dunzo is planning to raise $150-200 million from Middle East-based sovereign wealth funds at a valuation unchanged from its previous funding round, The Financial Express reported. The report added that Dunzo's largest shareholders, Reliance Retail and Google, are unlikely to participate in the round. Abu Dhabi Investment Authority (ADIA) is expected to lead the round.

145.title: Peace restored in troubled areas of NE due to development by NDA govt: Minister
145.article_body: Union minister G Kishan Reddy claimed that peace has been restored in troubled areas of northeast due to development implemented by the NDA government. "Under the leadership of PM Narendra Modi, substantial developments have taken place in...northeast in the last eight years like air, road, telecom and cultural connectivities," he said, adding the Centre has been developing 100 roadside amenities.

146.title: Eicher Motors appoints Vidhya Srinivasan as CFO
146.article_body: Eicher Motors announced on Friday that it has appointed Vidhya Srinivasan as the Chief Financial Officer (CFO). The appointment will be effective from November 18. Prior to joining the company, Srinivasan served at Bata India as Director-Finance and CFO. Srinivasan had also worked with organisations like Aditya Birla Retail Limited, Glenmark and Puma Sports India.

147.title: Rahul's words on Savarkar not acceptable, will cause cracks in alliance: Raut
147.article_body: Sanjay Raut, the spokesperson of Uddhav Thackeray's faction of Shiv Sena, said on Friday that Congress MP Rahul Gandhi's remarks on Veer Savarkar will not be accepted in Maharashtra. "What Rahul said about Veer Savarkar will cause cracks in the MVA alliance...Rahul has made his point clear for the umpteenth time...Why is he targeting Savarkar again and again," Raut added.

148.title: Ravi Kishan releases 'Gujarat Ma Modi Che' rap song ahead of polls
148.article_body: Actor-turned-politician Ravi Kishan on Friday released a rap song titled 'Gujarat Ma Modi Che' (Modi is in Gujarat) ahead of state Assembly elections. The BJP MP's Gujarati-Bhojpuri mix song talks about PM Narendra Modi's policies, his honesty and the development in Gujarat. Earlier, Bhojpuri singer Neha Singh Rathore released 'Gujarat Me Ka Ba' song, which criticised the BJP-led state government.

149.title: 'Maafiveer' banner put up in front of Savarkar's statue in Pune, 2 booked
149.article_body: The Maharashtra Police booked two Congress workers for pasting a "maafiveer" banner at freedom fighter VD Savarkar’s smarak in swargate area of Pune. This happened after Congress MP Rahul Gandhi alleged that Savarkar betrayed leaders like Mahatma Gandhi, Nehru and Sardar Patel by signing a letter of apology to the British.

150.title: Pankaj Tripathi to play Atal Bihari Vajpayee in former PM's biopic
150.article_body: Actor Pankaj Tripathi is set to play former Prime Minister Atal Bihari Vajpayee in his biopic titled 'Main Rahoon Ya Na Rahoon Yeh Desh Rehna Chahiye - Atal'. The film will be directed by Ravi Jadhav. Speaking about the upcoming project, Pankaj said in a statement, "It's my honour to portray such a humane politician on screen."

151.title: Lenskart raises nearly $40 mn in 5th funding round in 2022
151.article_body: Eyewear platform ﻿Lenskart﻿ announced that it has raised around $40 million in its fifth round of funding in 2022. The funding was raised from Chiratae Ventures, DSP India Fund and Axis Growth Avenues AIF-I. DSP India invested $15 million, while Chiratae Ventures and Axis invested $12.2 million each. Lenskart reported a net loss of ₹102.3 crore in FY22.

152.title: Not ruling out high-level talks with US on strategic stability: Russia
152.article_body: Russia's Deputy Foreign Minister Sergei Ryabkov has said that Russia is not ruling out further high-level meetings with the US on "strategic stability". The statement comes ahead of a meeting between the two countries in the Egyptian capital of Cairo on nuclear proliferation. Earlier, Ryabkov said that Moscow had nothing to discuss with the US on Ukraine.

153.title: Israel's 'most wanted gang leader' arrested in S Africa with 'torture van'
153.article_body: Israel's "most wanted gang leader" was arrested in Johannesburg in a joint operation by Interpol South Africa and special police units on Thursday, South African Police said. The leader, who has been on Interpol's wanted list since 2015, was arrested with seven others during a house raid. Guns, drugs and a van equipped for torture were seized during the raid.

154.title: 'She' & 'her' used for all genders for 1st time in draft bill in India: Reports
154.article_body: Union Minister of IT Ashwini Vaishnaw said that the pronouns "she" and "her" have been used to denote all genders in the draft Digital Personal Data Protection Bill, 2022, which was released for public views on Friday. This is said to be the first time in India's legislative history that "she" and "her" were used instead of "he" and "him".

155.title: Actors are given too much credit, they do nothing: Priyanka Chopra
155.article_body: Actress-producer Priyanka Chopra said in an interview that people give too much credit to actors, adding that their role in a movie is "very limited". "Actors do nothing by the way. We really don't," she said, adding, "We're working on a script...written by someone else, we're lip-syncing...songs that are in someone else's voice...We're dressed by somebody...So what am I doing?"

156.title: Qatar bans beer sales at FIFA World Cup stadiums: Reports
156.article_body: Qatar has banned the sale of beer at the eight stadiums where the FIFA World Cup 2022 will be played, days before the tournament's opening game, as per reports. This decision comes after months of tension between Qatari officials and FIFA. Notably, FIFA signed a $75 million sponsorship agreement with Budweiser, which is now said to be in jeopardy.

157.title: Keeping stray dogs doesn't mean you will affect people's lives: Supreme Court
157.article_body: The Supreme Court has dismissed a woman's plea seeking protection of 67 stray dogs which she claims to foster, saying, "Another bench is considering the matter." It also observed, "Keeping stray dogs does not mean you will take them to streets, fight and affect the lives of the people." The plea by an MP-based woman said strays weren't protected there.

158.title: Whenever I find out I'm going to NZ, it always brings smile to my face: Gill
158.article_body: Talking about playing in New Zealand ahead of T20I series, India opener Shubman Gill said he has some "fond memories" of the country. "Whenever I get to know I'll be going to New Zealand, it always brings a smile to my face," he added. "I came here for...first time...played...Under-19 World Cup...made my international debut here in...ODIs in 2019," he stated.

159.title: EV startup Chargeup raises $7 million from Capital-A and others
159.article_body: Finance-network-technology startup in the EV sector Chargeup has secured $7 million in a pre-Series A1 funding round led by Capital-A and Anicut Capital. The funding round saw participation from marquee investors including TV producer Ekta Kapoor, angel investor Sunil Kalra, Mastercard CFO Sachin Mehra and debt investor Jiraaf. The company was founded by Varun Goenka and Ankur Madan.

160.title: Youth assaulted, urinated upon by rival gang members in UP's Gonda
160.article_body: A youth was allegedly beaten up and urinated upon by rival gang members in Uttar Pradesh's Gonda. A video of the incident has surfaced on social media. According to police, the video was shot on October 31. An FIR has been registered under various charges, including attempt to murder and rioting, and one of the suspects has been arrested.

161.title: Language of this court is English: SC to man who spoke in Hindi
161.article_body: A two-judge bench on Friday told an elderly man, Shankar Lal Sharma, who was arguing in Hindi that the language of the Supreme Court is English. Additional Solicitor General Madhavi Goradia Divan, who was appearing in another court, rushed to help Sharma and translated the bench's words for him. Later, a lawyer agreed to assist him pro bono.

162.title: Piers Morgan asks users whining about Twitter's death to leave app, Musk reacts
162.article_body: As '#RIPTwitter' trended amid reports of mass resignations, British broadcaster Piers Morgan tweeted, "Could all the people currently whining about 'the death of Twitter' since Elon Musk bought it...just leave Twitter?" To this, Musk reacted by saying, "Seriously." The resignations came after Musk gave an ultimatum to Twitter employees to sign up for "long hours at high intensity" or leave.

163.title: Singer Waqar Khan joins NC in presence of Farooq Abdullah
163.article_body: Popular singer from Jammu and Kashmir, Waqar Khan, has joined the National Conference (NC) today in the presence of former CMs Farooq and Omar Abdullah. The party took to Twitter and said, "Prominent social activist and youth icon [Waqar Khan] along with scores of his supporters joined the JKNC." Waqar Khan hails from the Gurez area of the valley.

164.title: Imprisoned Russian activist Vladimir Kara-Murza gets human rights award
164.article_body: The UN Watch honoured an imprisoned Russian opposition activist, Vladimir Kara-Murza, with its highest human rights award. Kara-Murza's wife, Evgenia Kara-Murza, accepted the award and read out a letter that her husband had written in jail. "Since February, over 19,000 people were detained by police across Russia for anti-war protests...I want to dedicate this award to...them," he wrote.

165.title: Suspect, his family members booked for assaulting bailiff in Gurugram
165.article_body: A suspect and his family members were booked for allegedly assaulting a court official when he tried to execute a conditional arrest warrant issued by a Gurugram court, police said on Thursday. The alleged incident occurred on September 26 in Gurugram's Palam Vihar. The bailiff had reached Parveen Yadav's residence to take him to be produced before the court.

166.title: Habitual offender held in Mumbai, foreigner's stolen bag recovered in 6 hrs
166.article_body: Government Railway Police (GRP) in Mumbai's Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj Terminus arrested a habitual offender for stealing the bag of a New Zealand national, containing valuables worth ₹2.8 lakh, within six hours of the crime. The bag was stolen after the complainant kept it in a locker in the waiting room. Police examined CCTV footage and arrested the accused from Borivali.

167.title: Expecto Patrol-lus: Mumbai Police in Harry Potter-themed vigilance post
167.article_body: Mumbai Police took to social media to share a Harry Potter-themed post on vigilance. "Think you can manage mischief? Not on our watch! Always expect our patrol. We don't need any 'magic' to protect you!" they wrote. The police also used 'Mumbai Police on Watch', 'Anything For Mumbai' and 'Constant Vigilance' hashtags.

168.title: China should pay up for climate damage: German Development Minister
168.article_body: German Development Minister Svenja Schulze said China should contribute more to compensation payments for nations hit by climate-fuelled disasters. "China has 28% of greenhouse gas emissions at the moment. So they must...contribute to dealing with the damage," she added, saying, "They always hide behind the fact that they're a developing nation. But de facto they're no longer a developing nation."

169.title: IAS officer shares pics to announce Guj poll duty on Insta, removed from posting
169.article_body: IAS officer Abhishek Singh has been relieved of his poll duties for the upcoming Gujarat Assembly elections after he shared pictures and announced the posting on Instagram, multiple reports said on Friday. Pics he posted showed him posing with other poll officials and an armed security official. Election Commission reportedly said Singh used his official position "as a publicity stunt".

170.title: People won't forgive insults: MP CM on Rahul's remarks against Savarkar
170.article_body: Madhya Pradesh CM Shivraj Singh Chouhan criticised Congress MP Rahul Gandhi over his comments against freedom fighter VD Savarkar and said that people won't forgive insults. "Will the country tolerate the kind of statements Rahul Gandhi is making against Veer Savarkar? Congress has always honoured Nehru family. Have they ever counted contributions of...Sardar Patel?" said Chouhan.

171.title: K'taka Cong MLA gets death threat over proposed Tipu Sultan statue
171.article_body: Karnataka Congress on Thursday shared a video of a pro-Hindutva group's leader issuing death threat to Congress MLA Tanveer Sait after he announced the installation of a 100-foot-tall statue of Tipu Sultan in Mysuru. The accused warned Sait that "his last rites" would be held if he builds even a one-foot-tall statue of Sultan. Sait has lodged a police complaint.

172.title: Govt raises maximum tenure of PSU banks' CEO, MD to 10 years
172.article_body: The maximum tenure of the CEO and MD of public sector banks has been increased to 10 years from five years, subject to the superannuation age of 60 years. This is also applicable to whole-time directors of all Central Public Sector Enterprises. The amendment would be called Nationalised Banks (Management and Miscellaneous Provisions) Amendment Scheme, 2022, a government notification said.

173.title: Twitter staff left meeting even as Musk tried to convince them to stay: Report
173.article_body: Elon Musk reportedly held meetings with some employees who are considered key to Twitter's operations to try to persuade them to stay amid mass resignations on Thursday. However, some employees left the meeting being held via videoconference even as Musk continued speaking, the NYT reported. Earlier, Musk gave an ultimatum to employees to either commit to "hardcore" culture, or leave.

174.title: Educated girls shouldn't be in live-in relationships: Union Minister
