The repatriated individuals departed from Yangon for Kolkata, from where they will head to their respective hometowns, authorities confirmed.

348.title: VHP, Bajrang Dal members destroy banners of Ram Rahim at event in UP
348.article_body: Vishva Hindu Parishad (VHP) and Bajrang Dal members tore the banners and hoardings of Dera Sacha Sauda chief Gurmeet Ram Rahim, a murder and rape convict, at a 'satsang' programme held in Uttar Pradesh's Shahjahanpur. Ram Rahim is currently out on parole. Police stopped the event that was being held without obtaining prior permission.

349.title: You'll not know peace until you leave, we see you: Ukraine to Russia
349.article_body: Ukraine's Ministry of Defence has shared a video on Twitter, which claims to show five Russian soldiers being killed by the Ukrainian army in a border region. The video has been captioned, "We see you, Russians. Even in the dark. You will not know peace until you leave Ukraine." The video has garnered more than 400,000 views.

350.title: Fairfax denies reports of stake sale in Bangalore International Airport
350.article_body: Fairfax Financial Holdings has denied reports that it is planning to sell its stake in Bangalore International Airport Ltd (BIAL). The clarification came hours after a Bloomberg report emerged stating Fairfax's Indian arm is planning a $3.7 billion IPO of BIAL next year. Earlier reports also claimed that the Adani Group has approached Fairfax to buy a stake in BIAL.

351.title: UN-facilitated shipment of grain from Ukraine must continue: India
351.article_body: The UN-facilitated shipment of grain and fertilisers from Ukraine to the rest of the world via the Black Sea must continue, India has said at a briefing of the UN Security Council. The UN-brokered deal, finalised on July 22, had helped check global food prices amidst the Russia-Ukraine war. The agreement is set to expire on November 19.

352.title: Uddhav, others pay tributes to Bal Thackeray on his death anniversary
352.article_body: Former Maharashtra CM Uddhav Thackeray paid tributes to his father and Shiv Sena founder Bal Thackeray at his memorial at Mumbai's Shivaji Park on his death anniversary on Thursday. He was accompanied by his wife Rashmi Thackeray, their son Aaditya Thackeray and senior leaders of Shiv Sena (Uddhav Balasaheb Thackeray). CM Eknath Shinde had visited the memorial on Wednesday night.

353.title: Indecent & pathetic: BJP on Rahul Gandhi's remarks on Savarkar
353.article_body: BJP leader Sambit Patra on Thursday criticised Congress leader Rahul Gandhi for "insulting" Veer Savarkar during Bharat Jodo Yatra, calling his remarks indecent and pathetic. "This is very shameful that Rahul Gandhi did a press conference in Maharashtra and insulted the son of the state and freedom fighter," Patra said. He added that Rahul Gandhi should apologise to every Indian.

354.title: Bal Thackeray memorial 'purified' with gaumutra after Shinde's visit
354.article_body: Shiv Sena (Uddhav Balasaheb Thackeray) workers allegedly 'purified' Shiv Sena founder Bal Thackeray's memorial with gaumutra (cow urine) after Maharashtra CM Eknath Shinde visited the site on Wednesday. A purported video of the incident has surfaced online. Shinde had visited the site on the eve of Bal Thackeray's death anniversary. Uddhav Thackeray and Shinde head rival factions of Shiv Sena.

355.title: What do you need these many breaks for: Shastri on India head coach Dravid being rested
355.article_body: Reacting to India head coach Rahul Dravid being rested for the white-ball series against New Zealand, Ravi Shastri said, "What do you need that many breaks for?" He added, "You get your 2-3 months of the IPL, that's enough for you to rest as a coach." Shastri further said, "I think a coach should be hands on, whoever he is."

356.title: TN DGP sits on floor, has lunch with jail inmates during inspection
356.article_body: For the first time, the DGP of the Tamil Nadu Police (Prisons and Correctional Service) Amaraesh Pujari, during an inspection, sat on the floor and had lunch with inmates of the Puzhal Central Jail. Pujari listened to the grievances of the inmates and discussed measures aimed at their welfare, a senior state prison official said.

357.title: He wasn't criticising: China as video of Xi confronting Trudeau goes viral
357.article_body: After a video of Chinese President Xi Jinping confronting Canadian PM Justin Trudeau went viral, the Chinese Foreign Ministry said it "was a short conversation both leaders held during the G20 summit". "[It] shouldn't be interpreted as...Xi criticising or accusing anyone," the ministry said. Xi was reportedly confronting Trudeau over an alleged "leak" of details from a meeting they held.

358.title: Holiday on Nov 22 and 25 in 4 districts of Haryana due to panchayat polls
358.article_body: The Haryana government has declared a public holiday on November 22 and 25 in Faridabad, Palwal, Fatehabad and Hisar districts due to panchayat polls. The state government offices, boards, corporations and educational institutions will remain closed on these days. Zilla Parishad and Panchayat Samiti elections will be held on November 22, followed by Panch and Sarpanch elections on November 25.

359.title: Ahir regiment protest to be held in Gurugram tomorrow; police issues traffic advisory
359.article_body: Members of the Ahir community will be holding a protest near the Kherki Daula toll plaza in Gurugram on Friday demanding a separate regiment in the Indian Army. Police said protestors would march from the toll plaza to Hero Honda Chowk. Gurugram Traffic Police has listed alternative routes that commuters can take while travelling between Delhi, Jaipur, Gurugram and Manesar.

360.title: Bodies of 8 Indians killed in Maldives fire incident sent to India
360.article_body: The bodies of eight Indians who were killed in a fire incident in Male last week have been repatriated to India, the Indian High Commission in Maldives said on Thursday. "We thank Maldivian authorities for their support in this regard," it added. Ten people died in the incident that occurred in a garage below a cramped living quarter.

361.title: 2 Russians, 1 Ukrainian sentenced to life imprisonment for downing of MH17
361.article_body: A court in Netherlands on Thursday convicted and sentenced in absentia two Russians and a pro-Moscow Ukrainian separatist to life imprisonment for murdering 298 people, following the downing of Malaysia Airlines flight MH17 over Ukraine in 2014. Prosecutors contended the Boeing 777, which was flying to Kuala Lumpur from Amsterdam, was hit by a missile shot by Ukrainian separatists.

362.title: Man lifts & throws 8-yr-old girl to ground in Kerala; video surfaces
362.article_body: A 31-year-old man lifted an eight-year-old girl, who was waiting outside a Madrassa for her uncle, and threw her to the ground in Kerala's Manjeshwar on Thursday. The accused was arrested later, police said. A video of the incident shows the man walking towards the girl and hitting her.

363.title: I'd been with animal flow teacher for 6 months for 'Bhediya': Dhawan
363.article_body: Actor Varun Dhawan said that he had been with an animal flow teacher for around 6 months for his role in 'Bhediya'. "Too much hard work has gone into getting the physique right as the director (Amar Kaushik) didn't want my body to be tight...asked to cut down on the muscles," Dhawan added. Kriti Sanon also features in the film.

364.title: Centre moves SC seeking review of order releasing 6 Rajiv Gandhi assassination convicts
364.article_body: The Centre has filed a review petition in Supreme Court against its order allowing the release of six convicts in the Rajiv Gandhi assassination case. The Centre told the apex court that it wasn't heard in the matter as it wasn't made a party during the proceeding. The apex court had ordered release of the convicts on November 11.

365.title: Streaming devices maker Roku to lay off 200 employees in US
365.article_body: Roku, video streaming devices maker, will cut 5% of its staff or about 200 employees in US due to "current economic conditions". Roku will incur costs up to nearly $31 million in severance and other layoff payments in the fourth quarter. The firm's shares have fallen nearly 75% this year and is the latest tech company to plan layoffs.

366.title: Ensure only B'deshi migrants who back TMC enlisted in voter list: Bengal MLA
366.article_body: A West Bengal MLA has allegedly asked TMC workers to ensure only those Bangladeshi migrants who back the ruling party in the state are enlisted in the voters' list. "Many...people are coming...from Bangladesh. [Several of them] vote for BJP based on Hindu sentiments," MLA Khokan Das was purportedly heard saying in a video. Das allegedly made these comments in Bardhaman.

367.title: Won't allow conversions by fraud & deceit in Madhya Pradesh: CM Chouhan
367.article_body: Madhya Pradesh CM Shivraj Singh Chouhan has said that he won't allow religious conversions by fraud and deceit in the state at any cost. "[There's] a conspiracy going on [here]. There are some people who forcibly marry our daughters and later try to convert them," he added. Chouhan made these comments at a PESA awareness programme in Narmadapuram district.

368.title: Former bureaucrat Dr CV Ananda Bose appointed as Governor of West Bengal
368.article_body: Retired IAS officer Dr CV Ananda Bose has been appointed as the Governor of West Bengal, President Droupadi Murmu's office said. He'll be replacing La Ganesan, who assumed charge of the office after former Governor Jagdeep Dhankhar was elected as India's 14th Vice-President. He's previously served as Chief Secretary to Government of India and Principal Secretary to Chief Minister's office.

369.title: Kajol had a big crush on actor Akshay Kumar: Filmmaker Karan Johar
369.article_body: Actress Kajol, during her appearance on 'Jhalak Dikhhla Jaa 10', was asked by host Maniesh Paul to name her crush in Bollywood beside actor Ajay Devgn. To this, filmmaker Karan Johar replied, "She had a big crush on Akshay Kumar." The actress, who has worked with Johar in three films, will next star in 'Salaam Venky'.

370.title: MP CM to campaign for BJP in poll-bound Gujarat on November 18
370.article_body: Madhya Pradesh CM Shivraj Singh Chouhan will campaign for the BJP in poll-bound Gujarat on November 18, the CM's office said on Thursday. BJP leaders including Narottam Mishra, Vishvas Sarang, Arvind Bhadoria and Inder Singh Parmar have already been campaigning for BJP in Gujarat. Chouhan will address election meetings in Mandvi and Abdasa Assembly segments of Kutch district on Friday.

371.title: De-occupation of Crimea will end war, ceasefire won't: Ukraine's Prez
371.article_body: During an interview, Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy said, "A simple ceasefire won’t do the trick. Unless we liberate our whole territory, we will not bring peace." President Zelenskyy said the de-occupation of Crimea, which was annexed by Russia in 2014, and the country's long-occupied eastern Donbas region are conditions for bringing the nine-month war to an end.

372.title: Creditors realise ₹2.43 lakh crore through insolvency resolution till Sept
372.article_body: Banks, financial institutions and other creditors of stressed companies have realised ₹2.43 lakh crore through CIRPs (Corporate Insolvency Resolution Process) till September 30, an official report said. The fair value of the assets available with these corporate debtors was estimated at ₹2.14 lakh crore and a liquidation value of ₹1.37 lakh crore against the total claims worth ₹7.91 lakh crore.

373.title: 5G to add up to 2% of India's GDP amounting to $180 bn by 2030: Report
373.article_body: The 5G network technology is expected to contribute about 2% to India's GDP amounting to $180 billion by 2030, according to a report by NASSCOM and Arthur D Little. The report added that India is expected to have over 500 million 5G users by 2027. The report also expects 5G to enable a $1.5-trillion revenue potential globally by 2030.

374.title: Terrorism is Pakistan's one of foremost problems: PM Shehbaz Sharif
374.article_body: Pakistan Prime Minister Shehbaz Sharif on Wednesday said, "Let us make no mistake. Terrorism continues to be one of Pakistan's foremost problems." His comments came after six policemen were reportedly killed after two terrorists opened fire on a police van in Pakistan's Lakki Marwat. Tweeting over the same, PM Sharif said, "No words are enough to condemn [the] terrorists' attack."

375.title: Never in my career have I seen such a failure of corporate control: FTX's new CEO
375.article_body: Bankrupt crypto exchange FTX's new CEO John Ray said, "Never in my career have I seen such a complete failure of corporate controls and such a complete absence of trustworthy financial information as occurred here." He also criticised FTX's Co-founder and ex-CEO Sam Bankman-Fried for making "erratic and misleading public statements". Earlier, Binance cancelled a deal to buy FTX.

376.title: TMC's Anubrata Mondal arrested in multi-crore cattle smuggling scam
376.article_body: The Enforcement Directorate on Thursday arrested Trinamool Congress leader Anubrata Mondal in connection with a multi-crore cattle smuggling scam case. Earlier in the day, he was questioned inside the Asansol jail where he is currently lodged. The central probe agency has also questioned Mondal's daughter Sukanya at least thrice in this case.

377.title: UK is already in recession, declares UK's Finance Minister
377.article_body: The United Kingdom's Finance Minister Jeremy Hunt on Thursday said that the UK is now in recession and the economy is headed towards further shrinkage. Hunt tabled his emergency budget with £55 billion ($65 billion) of tax hikes and spending cuts. "There may be a recession made in Russia, but there is a recovery made in Britain," Jeremy Hunt said.

378.title: 2 Islamic teachers teach 'jihad' to 14-yr-old in an Assam madrassa; held
378.article_body: Assam Police have arrested two Islamic teachers for allegedly torturing a 14-year-old who accused them of teaching 'jihad' in a madrassa, officials said. The student alleged that the accused told them that they would receive blessings from Allah for "destroying" Hindus. He added he was beaten mercilessly for not attending their special classes post 11 pm.

379.title: 10-month-old boy dies during cold-cough treatment in Durg, doctors booked
379.article_body: Four doctors and three paramedical personnel of a private hospital in Chhattisgarh's Durg have been booked for alleged negligence after a 10-month-old boy died during treatment for cold and cough. Officials said the district health authority has cancelled the registration of Siddhi Vinayak Hospital and imposed a fine of ₹20,000 on its management. The baby, Shivansh Verma, died in October.

380.title: Bombay HC extends no coercive action against Anil Ambani till Dec 19
380.article_body: Bombay High Court has extended until December 19 its earlier order directing the Income Tax department to not take any coercive action against Reliance Group Chairman Anil Ambani. This comes after I-T department sought more time to file its affidavit. The I-T department had issued a show cause notice to Ambani in August for allegedly evading ₹420 crore in taxes.

381.title: 3 found guilty of shooting down plane over Ukraine in 2014, killing 298 on board
381.article_body: A Dutch court on Thursday convicted three men of murder for their role in shooting down Malaysia Airlines passenger flight MH17 over Ukraine in 2014. Two Russian former intelligence officers and a Ukrainian separatist leader were found guilty of downing the plane and killing all 298 people on board. The fourth suspect on trial was acquitted.

382.title: Amit Shah, JP Nadda, Yogi among BJP star campaigners for MCD polls
382.article_body: BJP has released a list of 40 star campaigners for the upcoming Municipal Corporation of Delhi (MCD) elections. The list includes BJP chief JP Nadda, Home Minister Amit Shah, Delhi BJP chief Adesh Gupta, MP Gautam Gambhir, UP CM Yogi Adityanath, and actor-turned-politician Hema Malini, among others. The voting for 250 wards in Delhi will be held on December 4.

383.title: There was time when I couldn't choose roles as I needed money: Neena
383.article_body: Actress Neena Gupta recalled the time when she could not choose her roles as she needed money to run her house. "Today if something doesn't excite me, I simply don't do it. One of the biggest changes that have happened is the fact that I am in a position to say no," she further added. Neena recently featured in 'Uunchai'.

384.title: NHRC issues notice to Punjab govt over video of girls crossing Sutlej river to reach school
384.article_body: National Human Rights Commission (NHRC) has issued a notice to Punjab government after a video showing two girls riding a boat across Sutlej river to reach school surfaced online. The video showed the girls riding on a 'bedi' (a boat manoeuvred using an overhead cable). "State has responsibility to ensure [girls'] safety and to safeguard their human rights," NHRC said.

385.title: K'taka seeks employees' one-day salary for cow adoption programme
385.article_body: The Karnataka government has issued an order approving the deduction of one day's salary of government employees to fund the state's cow adoption programme. The one-time contribution is expected to generate around ₹100 crore. Those not willing to contribute have been directed to give a written request by November 25.

386.title: About 100 startups registered with ISRO: Chairman S Somanath
386.article_body: Indian Space Research Organisation (ISRO) Chairman S Somanath said that about 100 startups are registered with it and are working on domains of the space sector. Speaking at the Bengaluru Tech Summit 2022, Somanath added that of those, at least 10 are working on developing satellites and rockets. He also said that ISRO is working with NASA in space technology.

387.title: BJP's MCD manifesto a 'betrayal document' to mislead Delhiites: Cong
387.article_body: Congress leader Alka Lamba on Thursday said that BJP's manifesto for MCD elections is a "betrayal document" to mislead Delhiites. "Despite ruling...MCD for 15 years, the BJP doesn't have any achievement to highlight or any issue to project," Lamba said. "Congress will fight for...cause of...slum dwellers and fulfil its promise of free in situ flats for them," she added.

388.title: Sri Lanka Navy arrests 14 Tamil Nadu fishermen, seizes their boats
388.article_body: The Sri Lanka Navy arrested 14 Indian fishermen and seized their boats for alleged maritime boundary violation on Wednesday. The incident took place when the fishermen, who are from Tamil Nadu, were fishing in the Indian Ocean. In a separate incident, a fisherman from Rameswaram allegedly sustained an injury in his eye after being attacked by Lankan naval personnel.

389.title: T'gana govt to distribute 33 lakh health kits to girls in schools, colleges
389.article_body: Telangana government has decided to distribute 33 lakh 'Adolescent Health Kits' to girls studying in Class 8 to Class 12 of government schools and colleges to improve menstrual health. Each adolescent kit will contain a zipper bag, packs of sanitary napkins and a water bottle. The government will spend an amount of around ₹70 crore on the programme.

390.title: Bride cancels wedding as groom's family sends 'cheap' lehenga in U'khand
390.article_body: A bride in Uttarakhand cancelled her wedding after the groom's family sent her a "cheap" wedding lehenga, costing "only" ₹10,000. The groom's father reportedly gave the bride his ATM card to buy a lehenga she liked, but it went in vain. The girl got engaged to the boy in June and the wedding was to take place on November 5.

391.title: Maha speaker urges CM to build guesthouse at Ayodhya for pilgrims
391.article_body: Maharashtra Assembly Speaker Rahul Narwekar, in a letter to CM Eknath Shinde, has demanded that a guesthouse be built in UP's Ayodhya for pilgrims. Narwekar urged Shinde to request Uttar Pradesh CM Yogi Adityanath to allot land for the construction of the guesthouse at Ayodhya. He also stated that he was writing to convey the wishes of "thousands of devotees".

392.title: UP CM Yogi orders construction of new court buildings in 10 districts
392.article_body: Uttar Pradesh CM Yogi Adityanath on Thursday ordered the construction of court buildings equipped with advanced facilities in 10 districts, an official release stated. He asked the Public Works Department and the Planning Department officials to submit a detailed presentation within 15 days. The CM also instructed officials to ensure strict security arrangements are made in all courts.

393.title: SEBI notifies rules on mutual fund dividends, redemption proceeds
393.article_body: The Securities and Exchange Board of India (SEBI) notified new rules under which every mutual fund and asset management company has to transfer dividend and redemption proceeds to unit holders within a specified period. In case payments aren't made on time, companies would have to pay interest to unit holders. The new rules will come into effect from January 15.

394.title: Veer Savarkar's grandson lodges complaint against Rahul Gandhi for insulting Savarkar
394.article_body: Ranjit Savarkar, the grandson of late freedom fighter Veer Savarkar, on Thursday registered a complaint against Congress leader Rahul Gandhi for insulting Savarkar. "Rahul Gandhi said that Veer Savarkar took pension and worked for Britishers. [He also stated that my grandfather] worked against the country," Ranjit said.

395.title: What is a narco test which Aftab Poonawala will undergo?
395.article_body: Aftab Poonawala, who's accused of murdering his live-in partner in Delhi, will undergo narco test, which is used for lie detection. In such a test, drugs like sodium pentothal are injected into accused's body, which transport them to hypnotic/sedated state. In this state, accused are understood as being incapable of lying, and are expected to divulge information that is true.

396.title: Working with trans women has been incredible in 'Haddi': Nawazuddin
396.article_body: Actor Nawazuddin Siddiqui, speaking about working with transgender women in his upcoming film 'Haddi', has said that their presence was "empowering". He added, "Working with real-life trans women has been an incredible experience in Haddi, an honour and a privilege to understand & learn more about the community." 'Haddi' is directed by Akshat Ajay Sharma.

397.title: K'taka HC adjourns Twitter's plea against Centre's takedown orders
397.article_body: The Karnataka High Court has adjourned Twitter's plea against Centre's order asking it to remove tweets, accounts and URLs on the platform to December 12. Twitter said government's blocking orders are against Supreme Court guidelines. Centre directed Twitter to block 1,474 accounts, 175 Tweets, 256 URLs and one hashtag between February 2, 2021 and February 28, 2022.

398.title: SEBI working on rules to regulate financial influencers on social media
398.article_body: Securities and Exchange Board of India (SEBI) is working on guidelines to regulate the growing base of financial influencers who give advice to investors on social media, a senior official said. SEBI requires financial advisers to register themselves as investment advisers. In FY22, there were 415 cases of violations by influencers and celebrities in finance- and cryptocurrency-related content.

399.title: Maharashtra govt doubles pension of freedom fighters to ₹20,000
399.article_body: The state government has decided to double the pension of freedom fighters who took part in the Indian independence movement, the Marathwada Mukti Sangram and the Goa liberation struggle in Maharashtra. The pension has been increased from ₹10,000 to ₹20,000, Deputy CM Devendra Fadnavis tweeted. The decision was taken at a cabinet meeting chaired by CM Eknath Shinde on Thursday.

400.title: Delhi records season's lowest temperature at 11.3°C
400.article_body: Delhi recorded its lowest temperature of the season this year, at 11.3°C, on Thursday, according to weather forecasting service Skymet Weather. The maximum temperature on Thursday was recorded at 27.5°C. The minimum temperature could drop to 10°C by Saturday, the service said. Delhi recorded an air quality index (AQI) of 260 on Thursday, remaining in the 'poor' category, CPCB said.

401.title: 135 crore young people risk hearing loss due to headphones, loud music: Study
401.article_body: Around 135 crore people aged 12-34 years globally risk hearing loss due to unsafe listening practices from exposure to listening devices like headphones and earbuds, and loud entertainment venues, according to a study. The study reviewed data from 33 peer-reviewed studies on hearing loss. The international team behind the study said the governments need to prioritise "safe listening" policies.

402.title: Rajasthan govt set to issue NRR cards for diaspora population
402.article_body: The Rajasthan government is set to provide NRR Cards to the Rajasthani diaspora living outside the state as part of the CM Ashok Gehlot government's Non-Resident Rajasthani (NRR) policy. The initiatives under the policy include 'Mhari Dani' where voluntarily contributions can be made for projects and 'Pravasi Mitra' where guidance would be provided to card holders in foreign countries.
